alert.note: Alert for Washington (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 7:45AM CST until further notice by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Austin and Washington. * WHEN...Until 145 PM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 744 AM CST, Multiple roadways around Brenham are inundated from both runoff and local rainfall. Flooding is ongoing. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brenham, Shelby, Industry, Burton, Quarry and Independence. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Mikeska Road at East Mill Creek, East Phillips Street at Possum Branch, Farm to Market 109 at Williams Creek, Copelyn Springs Road at New Year Creek, Old Navasota Road at New Year Creek, Burleson Street at Little Sandy Creek, Old Chappell Hill Rd at Felchak Branch, Old Masonic Road at Big Sandy Creek, Trackside Road at Browning Branch, Nicholson Lake Road at Caney Creek, Caney Creek Road at Caney Creek Tributary, North Park St at Higgens Branch, Kuykendall Road at Kuykendall Creek Relief, County Road 84 at Little Cedar Creek Tributary, Randermann Road at Peach Creek, CR 80 (Old Chappell Hill Road) at Woodward Cr, Christian Cemetary Road at Kerr Creek Tributary, County Road 6 at Burns Creek, Sandstone Road, South Saeger Street at Higgens Branch Tributary, Key St at Hog Branch, Farm to Market 2935 at Little Sandy Creek and CR 62 (Jeske Rd) at Rocky Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
